doc.field: Legislative Districts - State House and Senate - Twin Cities Metro Area
Legislative Districts - State House and Senate - Twin Cities Metro Area

This data is a Twin Cities metro area version of the 2002 Minnesota Legislative Districts dataset from the Minnesota Legislative Coordinating Commission (see http://www.gis.leg.mn/metadata/leg02.htm ). It includes only those State House of Representative and State Senate Districts which overlap the Twin Cities 7 County Area.
Base data and features are derived from the 2000 TIGER files prepared by the U.S. Census Bureau.
State Legislative Districts ordered by the Minnesota Supreme Court Special Redistricting Panel in the matter of Zachman v. Kiffmeyer, case #C0-01-160, on March 19, 2002. Dataset also includes Minnesota Session Laws 2003, 1st Special Session, Chapter 16 - H.F.No. 66 Sect. 13 (adjustment between house districts 45A and 45B).

</spref> <eainfo> <overview> <eaover>Polygon Attributes:
DISTRICT: The district number.
SENATE: The Senate District
SEN_5COLOR: A symbolizing scheme for Senate Districts
HOUSE: House district A or B for that Senate District
HSE_5COLOR: A symbolizing scheme for House districts
TRNSPRNSY: Allows symbolizing by Senate District and shading by House District</eaover> <eadetcit /> </overview> </eainfo> <distinfo> <distrib> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>Mark Kotz</cntper> <cntorg>Metropolitan Council</cntorg> </cntperp> <cntpos>GIS Database Administrator</cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype> mailing and physical address </addrtype> <address>390 Robert Street North</address> <city>St. Paul</city> <state>Minnesota</state> <postal>55101-1805</postal> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>651-602-1644</cntvoice> <cntfax>651-602-1674</cntfax> <cntemail>mark.kotz@metc.state.mn.us</cntemail> </cntinfo> </distrib> <resdesc>LegislativeDistricts</resdesc> <distliab>NOTICE: The Geographic Information System (GIS) Data to which this notice is attached are made available pursuant to the Minnesota Government Data Practices Act (Minnesota Statutes Chapter 13).
